template <typename Obj>
class vsip::impl::Ref_counted_ptr

 constructor Ref_counted_ptr()
 constructor Ref_counted_ptr(Obj* p)

-

Basic constructor from an object.

More...

Basic constructor from an object. This takes a pointer to the object so that you write "Ref_counted_ptr<T> ptr(&obj)" just like an ordinary pointer.

 constructor Ref_counted_ptr(Obj* p, noincrement_type)

-

Variant constructor which does not increment the reference count.

More...

Variant constructor which does not increment the reference count. This is useful when the object has just been constructed, so it already has a reference count of 1, and this is the sole handle.

 constructor Ref_counted_ptr(const Ref_counted_ptr& p)

Copy-constructor, always increments the reference count.

 destructor ~Ref_counted_ptr()

Destructor.

 Ref_counted_ptr& operator=(const Ref_counted_ptr& from)

operator= always increments the reference count of the new object and decrements the reference count of the old object.

 void reset(Obj* p, bool increment = false)
